High-level visits to Taiwan (A) are important for long-term relations but could be seen as provocative now. The options involving reducing dialouge or escalating conflicts (L, O, P, Q, R, S) are less reasonable as they risk significant escalation or global repercussions without achieving U.S. objectives. A trade agreement (D) is less urgent amidst military tensions, and formal peace negotiations (F) or arbitration (E) might not be productive in this heightened climate.
